points.point: It is used to implementation of the Singleton pattern in kotlin.
An object can derive from a class or implement interfaces.
Object declarations can't be local (that is, they can't be nested directly inside a function), but they can be nested into other object declarations or non-inner classes.
Just like data classes in data object the compiler generates toString(), equals(), hashCode().
You can't provide a custom equals or hashCode implementation for a data object.
Data object does not have copy() and componentN().
